reviewText: This to me has to be my favorite Benji movie! It has very little dialogue but extreme amounts of emotion. I've seen more emotion from the animals than any other animal movie. This is a MUST for all who want a good message at the end.After a shipwreck, Benji survives and is stranded in the wilderness trying to figure out how to get out of the bind he's in. He quickly changes goals and plays "mother" when he discovers young orphaned Cougar Cubs when he finds out that a hunter shot and killed the mother. Benji has a few oppurtunities to go back home to his master but he sacrifices his life and time to try to persuade another mother Cougar to adopt the cubs. During his adventurous goals, he discovers a Wolf is after the cubs for a quick and easy meal. Benji tries to steer the Wolf away from the cubs putting his own life on the line. To add, the music is powerful and emotional that fits perfectly with the story.I just recieved the DVD through Amazon, and I have mixed reveiws. Although seeing the movie once again does go above what I consider "the little negative things" about this DVD, I was still  a little bummed that the DVD only has the 'full-screen' edition and the quality of a VHS. Other than that, I'm just glad that Amazon has finally released this movie! :) I will gladly own this until they at least release this in 'wide-screen'.
summary: My All Time Favorite Benji Movie!!! :)

reviewText: This is a great movie for children.(especially if they love dogs) Sure it's pretty far-fetched in places, sure it seems cheesy at times but they won't even notice. The little dog that plays Benji in this movie (Her name is Benjean) is one of the cutest dogs you will ever come across in a movie. I watched this movie over and over as a child on an old beat up video tape that my grandmother recorded off of network tv! Haha.I picked up the DVD to keep for my kids or friends kids to watch as well. Whenever it is on I still find myself laughing at the little cubs and the way Benjean interacts with them. The scene where she first hears them, and she SLOWLY peaks around the corner of a rock to see what is making the noise, she takes on an almost human quality. I can only imagine the time and effort it must have taken to tape and retape this movie and the training the little dog must have received to be able to convey her expressions and do some of the things she does in the film.If you are looking for a unique movie for the kids to enjoy, I highly recommend picking this up for a few dollars. In a time when Disney is full of Pixar Animation, this is a great change of pace and a classic in my book.
summary: If you have children they will love this movie

reviewText: My children loved this when they were little (I loved watching it with them). Now I have a 3 year old granddaughter who bores easily with TV but she LOVED this movie and requested to watch it again (I don't let her watch that much TV, but unusual for her to request a movie twice in the same day!). I found myself loving the movie even more now that I am getting older. The minimal talking I think is what gives this movie more magic and lets children imagine what is going through the animals' minds more. It has a sad beginning but necessary for the plot--overall this is just a wonderful movie--one of the best ever made.

reviewText: Benji is stranded in a forest where he must forego being rescued to find a mother for 4 orphaned mountain lion cubs. There are very few humans in the film and, thus, precious little dialogue. SO, kids will love it because it  is practically all action. I was amazed at how the Benji dog could 'act' so  well. The trainers, directors, et al must have spent months teaching Benji,  then months more doing takes and re-takes to get his actions and reactions  just right.  RENT IT. BUY IT. IT WILL BE A FAVORITE IN YOUR FAMILY FOR  YEARS TO COME!!
summary: You'll be Awed by this Dog's "Acting"

reviewText: If you're a fan of Siskel & Ebert, then you'll know why this movie is rather infamous. Back in 1987, Ebert gave Full Metal Jacket a thumbs down while he gave Benji The Hunted a thumbs up. It became a rather heated debate on the show, and people still remember the argument between the two critics. I agree with Siskel that Full Metal Jacket is a great war film (it's in fact one of my favorite films of all time). But at the same time, I do agree with Ebert that Benji the Hunted is a film that's tailored specifically for kids. This is not a movie for adults, and it shows. As an adult, I find this movie to be a bit silly and tedious. A little dog that must survive in the wilderness isn't really one that would interest grownups. I will say, however, that there are some nice shots of forests and mountains. There are a few tender moments in the film, but these kinds of moments are for little children, of course. In the end, Benji The Hunted is a kids film that may or may not be very enticing for adults (except those who grew up watching this). Children will probably like it, but adults will certainly find it pretty dull and uninteresting.Grade: C
summary: Pretty silly and tedious, but it IS a kids film

reviewText: I have seen it about 3 times now and still enjoyed it.  Main theme of the movie is about humanity and survival.  Benji had many chances to be rescued with his owner, but he had a good sense with task at hand first to bring the orphaned cubs to their "adopted" mother and putting his rescue with his owner on hold.  The most impressive part on Benji's part is his courage to overcome the obstacle uphill the cliff bringing the cubs to their "adopted" mother.  I loved every minute of it.  This is a family movie and good for everyone of any age.For people who wants to know if this DVD has caption or subtitle.  It does have caption.  The DVD cover doesn't show caption symbol on it, but the DVD itself does.  I know Amazon.com listed it closed-captioned.  But, they don't always list the info. correctly as it happened to me in the past.  So, I double-checked the Disney website and they show the menu demo that this movie has caption before I decided to buy the DVD.  If you have TV with caption on, then you can leave subtitle from menu off, otherwise, caption and subtitle will show up at the same time.

reviewText: "Benji the Hunted" is supposedly the last Benji film made so far, and I hope that is the case. This film is extraordinarily DULL and BORING! The opening sequence is the only thing that I actually liked. After that, it's all downhill from there. The viewer has to suffer through 90 minutes of Benji the dog and his animal friends mating and playing in the woods, complete with some terrible '80s synthesizer music and repetitive nature scenes. Almost no dialogue or action occurs during the film.  There are only three major human actors in it, and they are on-screen for about 5 to 10 minutes. Man, is this movie deadly! No wonder it got ignored by the public, and shame on Disney for releasing such a flat-out boring movie like this back in the late '80s. This movie is also an insult to the original "Benji" from 1974, which I really liked as a child and probably still do.
summary: The absolute WORST Disney film ever!

reviewText: Several reviewers had a problem with this because it has almost no dialogue. When my youngest daughter first watched it, I made the mistake of voicing my own version of what Benji, lost in the wild, might be thinking, such as "Oh [...]! That's the biggest damn cat I ever saw!" This cracked Bianca up (she was only eight or so) and she made me do constant dialogue for all the animals for the rest of the movie, and for each subsequent viewing. After about four times through it over six months, I was tapped out of ideas, and she moved on to movies for which I did not have to create spontaneous scripts. Yet, that half-a-year with Benji is one of the best memories of parenting this now 17-year-old. If your kid thinks the movie is too slow, try this stunt. You may get a ton of laughs.
summary: The right kid, and the right parent, can have great fun...
